item.title: Urgent removal poisonous Hemlock, 17th June

We need the large poisonous hemlock removed in the communal allotments

item.title: Furniture dumped in bin, 17th June
item.description:
The lady in the picture dumped the items plus more in a communal bin. She doesn’t not live in this building, she approached me when I parked my van very aggressively. She told me the council would not take it so she’s dumping it here. The building is Lincoln house, the person lives at 10 Boyd way

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Boyd Way, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping in layby end of Linsey St, 17th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Linsey Street, Bermondsey, London

item.title: Highway blocked, 17th June
item.description:
Continuing issue with pavements being blocked by crowds from the pub opposite.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shepherdess Walk, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drug users & homeless campsite, 17th June
item.description:
This has been up for several days, there are local well know.n drug users and professional beggars from London Bridge in and out all day. Today around 8-10 of them were hanging around it. There are noises coming from it in the morning along with lots of waste and litter strewn around. This side of the park feels unsafe.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Hatchers Mews, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drains, 17th June
item.description:
Hyde Park Barracks, South Carriage Drive (facing the park) entrance report of several blocked drains causing rain water over flow during downpours and the risk of horse and rider slips at the park side entrance to the barracks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kensington Road, Knightsbridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned supermarket trolleys, 17th June
item.description:

item.title: Report 7705276, 17th June
item.description:
I reported that the street cleaner walked past Palewell close and not collected litter. I have now received an email to state the problem has been fixed. I can assure you it has not been fixed. There is litter everywhere. If anyone had been here they were very selective in what they had done.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Palewell Close, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Narrow access, 17th June
item.description:
Coming from Weighton Road to the temporary pedestrian crossing over Croydon Road has very narrow access. My daughter uses a wheelchair and where the lights are positioned she can only get through the gap by going off the pavement. This is also narrow for buggies, prams etc and large wheelchairs or double buggies would not get through. They would need to go on the road which is dangerous. The storage of metal barriers needs to move to give access to wheelchair users to the pedestrian lights.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 166, Croydon Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole on Walton road, 17th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 78, Walton Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
